job_title: Clinical Nurse Specialist in London, England
cons: No progression clinically beyond a band 7

pros: Good work life balance. 9-5 with minimum weekend and afternoon working. This is paradise for someone worked in Asia before
cons: Things can get inefficient, but it's the NHS

job_title: Pre-registration Trainee Pharmacist in London, England
pros: Teaching is a big focus at this trust which makes it a good place for new staff to learn
cons: Bad retention rate due to lack of staff/funding (however this is a nationwide problem)

review_title: stress is not worth the poor salary

job_title: Community Mental Health Nurse in Manchester, England
pros:
Great manager, felt I can able to trust.
Able to work from home on occasions (since the pandemic), before the pandemic, it was office based.
cons: Limited funds for external trainings that I wanted to undertake to further my career.

job_title: Trainee Psychological Wellbeing Practitioner in London, England
pros: Good support from the management team
cons: The area presents a lot of complexity so patients maybe very complex

review_title: Wonderful service provided by hard working dedicated friendly staff
pros: Wonderful service provided by hard working dedicated friendly staff
cons: NHS services often stretched and this can be stressful

job_title: Assistant Management Accountant in London, England
pros:
First 4 years worked with very friendly staff. Did very well in my job in Financial Accounts and Cashiers.
Career progression is good .
cons:
Last 4 years was filled with bullying in the Management Accounts department.
Bullying is rife. Was told that over 40's must leave and let younger people get work.
Complained to management and told I was too sensitive.
Some managers rule the roost and if they take a dislike to you, will never stop hounding you until you leave.
High turnover of staff in a certain area of finance.
